document.title: Maryland College and Career Ready Standards for English language Arts Grades 6-8

8451B462C41D4ADAB46511B051BBF193.description:
Acquire and use accurately grade
appropriate general academic and domainspecific words and phrases; gather vocabulary
knowledge when considering a word or phrase
important to comprehension or expression.

AB9C4501026E490DBA0451D12C7A861E.description:
Distinguish among the
connotations (associations) of words with
similar denotations (definitions) (e.g.,
stingy, scrimping, economical, thrifty).

0E37447B8E0D4581A2D6DF9686C020EE.description:
Use the relationship between
particular words (e.g., cause/effect,
part/whole, item/category) to better
understand each of the words.

DA78003DF76C431194AB7E99A79748AE.description:
Interpret figures of speech (e.g.,
personification) in context.

3D8C7B6BF11A470B95E6545FF86224E5.description:
Demonstrate understanding of figurative
language, word relationships, and nuances in
word meanings.

A9F1CB8643914BA998D0A27C4AB99C8A.description:
Verify the preliminary
determination of the meaning of a word or
phrase (e.g., by checking the inferred
meaning in context or in a dictionary).

266E80C46D5B4CD486E7F4E42B9CE29D.description:
Consult reference materials (e.g.,
dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses), both
print and digital, to find the pronunciation
of a word or determine or clarify its
precise meaning or its part of speech.

0596D5D17DBC47D486B0F44654E8D056.description:
Use common, grade appropriate
Greek or Latin affixes and roots as clues to
the meaning of a word (e.g., audience,
auditory, audible).

4EA3B548C9DF49DF9DDAD97A0A5B58B4.description:
Use context (e.g., the overall
meaning of a sentence or paragraph; a
word's position or function in a sentence)
as a clue to the meaning of a word or
phrase.

06FBB93376EC44B79F3B0E23667EAECA.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of
unknown and multiple-meaning words and
phrases based on grade 6 reading and content,
choosing flexibly from a range of strategies.

5A7B99DC0FDF42C4925181CC27F13F17.description:
Maintain consistency in style and
tone. *

5DAAFCBCB832415DA8206C45AB80B692.description:
Vary sentence patterns for
meaning, reader/listener interest, and
style.*

62535E922D2345FD901F061EE3503A9B.description:
Use knowledge of language and its
conventions when writing, speaking, reading,
or listening.

11C564298E77406C92309B81842F32B5.description:
Use punctuation (commas,
parentheses, dashes) to set off
nonrestrictive/parenthetical elements. *

385BDD6CF6CB4B5CA1088AAB179F175D.description:
Demonstrate command of the
conventions of standard English capitalization,
punctuation, and spelling when writing.

96ABD04709744A31B57FE64BBFE5477E.description:
Recognize variations from
standard English in their own and others'
writing and speaking, and identify and use
strategies to improve expression in
conventional language. *

243E1677A1CD48B3BFB6C8560165A02A.description:
Recognize and correct vague
pronouns (i.e., ones with unclear or
ambiguous antecedents).*

E3F79139E08141CA96D1A5727506BDB6.description:
Recognize and correct
inappropriate shifts in pronoun number
and person.*

F97D6704C1F44989BC3DAC34145F6F1F.description:
Ensure that pronouns are in the
proper case (subjective, objective,
possessive).

E7F14544C0904ED5AD7EF4D76BC3A786.description:
Demonstrate command of the
conventions of standard English grammar and
usage when writing or speaking.

0D0E535998F24235859818CFD8A6F80C.description:
Adapt speech to a variety of contexts
and tasks, demonstrating command of formal
English when indicated or appropriate. (See
grade 6 Language standards 1 and 3 for specific
expectations.)

13C326661FCB414BAF19632CFF40D9B8.description:
Include multimedia components (e.g.,
graphics, images, music, sound) and visual
displays in presentations to clarify information.

88A1CCD68D93494D83F7D8F3D88C5C33.description:
Present claims and findings, sequencing
ideas logically and using pertinent descriptions,
facts, and details to accentuate main ideas or
themes; use appropriate eye contact, adequate
volume, and clear pronunciation.

3C4A46E7A3FC4157829A2CB9B08B7696.description:
Delineate a speaker's argument and
specific claims, distinguishing claims that are
supported by reasons and evidence from
claims that are not.

CB72D02E536A45C285A92D685F364DCB.description:
Interpret information presented in
diverse media and formats (e.g., visually,
quantitatively, orally) and explain how it
contributes to a topic, text, or issue under
study.

6DE99FB696C94DB094159A439E84E192.description:
Review the key ideas expressed
and demonstrate understanding of
multiple perspectives through reflection
and paraphrasing.

2847D651B09F465FB34D9D0F5451D387.description:
Pose and respond to specific
questions with elaboration and detail by
making comments that contribute to the
topic, text, or issue under discussion.

236B3357F29346599FBE2A178B98FA93.description:
Follow rules for collegial
discussions, set specific goals and
deadlines, and define individual roles as
needed.

9F1B9C71566141A9A657431FBC4E56F2.description:
Come to discussions prepared,
having read or studied required material;
explicitly draw on that preparation by
referring to evidence on the topic, text, or
issue to probe and reflect on ideas under
discussion.

6FCD20B3CF73433D900178745EDF0181.description:
Engage effectively in a range of
collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in
groups, and teacher-led) with diverse partners
on grade 6 topics, texts, and issues, building on
others' ideas and expressing their own clearly.

D475CD9EB8D04A8BB7581A9E11390629.description:
Write routinely over extended time
frames (time for research, reflection, and
revision) and shorter time frames (a single
sitting or a day or two) for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences.

CB6F77DBB25C4767B2776D1FEC6E41D6.description:
Apply grade 6 Reading standards
to literary nonfiction (e.g., "Trace and
evaluate the argument and specific claims
in a text, distinguishing claims that are
supported by reasons and evidence from
claims that are not").

1F84646C1A93413E8675936EC1A0BB81.description:
Apply grade 6 Reading standards
to literature (e.g., "Compare and contrast
texts in different forms or genres [e.g.,
stories and poems; historical novels and
fantasy stories] in terms of their
approaches to similar themes and topics").

F126780389B64BA58BACD415C03C0A7E.description:
Draw evidence from literary or
informational texts to support analysis,
reflection, and research.

3C32F54BF72F4C92B36B236FAD93EA3D.description:
Gather relevant information from
multiple print and digital sources; assess the
credibility of each source; and quote or
paraphrase the data and conclusions of others
while avoiding plagiarism and providing basic
bibliographic information for sources.

08B492B9F22C45E4B55346BC738082B8.description:
Conduct short research projects to
answer a question, drawing on several sources
and refocusing the inquiry when appropriate.

32CD170F1E8A4146A51572A5C3177BCF.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

DF7AFDA1647248A1970B77D36A924892.description:
Use technology, including the Internet,
to produce and publish writing as well as to
interact and collaborate with others;
demonstrate sufficient command of
keyboarding skills to type a minimum of three
pages in a single sitting.

E0E1A4C0620942E8A914BC85DFC1A56B.description:
With some guidance and support from
peers and adults, develop and strengthen
writing as needed by planning, revising,
editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach.
(Editing for conventions should demonstrate
command of Language standards 1-3 up to and
including grade 6.)

9909DE2B89674790882E9218B5C88DA0.description:
Produce clear and coherent writing in
which the development, organization, and
style are appropriate to task, purpose, and
audience. (Grade-specific expectations for
writing types are defined in standards 1-3
above.)

279209291B4C4B51AD6AE3DBDA28D8CD.description:
Provide a conclusion that follows
from the narrated experiences or events.

8502D319DF264D83AC54922F0181F78B.description:
Use precise words and phrases,
relevant descriptive details, and sensory
language to convey experiences and
events.

F623FE822C8A4ADC90C1A39949BB0D48.description:
Use a variety of transition words,
phrases, and clauses to convey sequence
and signal shifts from one time frame or
setting to another.

1E079B12851F48FA9FE479F6B51C878C.description:
Use narrative techniques, such as
dialogue, pacing, and description, to
develop experiences, events, and/or
characters.

39C9CDE43E6947E398DC651B787E635A.description:
Engage and orient the reader by
establishing a context and introducing a
narrator and/or characters; organize an
event sequence that unfolds naturally and
logically.

8827A4CF89124101A1CCE778F89A2357.description:
Write narratives to develop real or
imagined experiences or events using effective
technique, relevant descriptive details, and
well-structured event sequences.

3E531FFB39234FBFA76E60D7992C058D.description:
Provide a concluding statement or
section that follows from the information or
explanation presented.

61BC11AA689A4211898943648E094348.description:
Establish and maintain a formal
style.

821ABD112073422DB61CB8D91A6ABD8E.description:
Use precise language and
domain-specific vocabulary to inform
about or explain the topic.

51D01C2C72BC4B06BB44B939B1AEE9CD.description:
Use appropriate transitions to
clarify the relationships among ideas and
concepts.

BB048575F4E945F6A0A2D8BC02FCFBEA.description:
Develop the topic with relevant
facts, definitions, concrete details,
quotations, or other information and
examples.

C8E18E86CC0B4E97AFF52BFA8A7D75AC.description:
Introduce a topic; organize
ideas, concepts, and information, using
strategies such as definition,
classification, comparison/contrast, and
cause/effect; include formatting(e.g.,
headings), graphics (e.g., charts, tables),
and multimedia when useful to aiding
comprehension.

5552D43D0D6E4959B328A67305122753.description:
Write informative/explanatory texts to
examine a topic and convey ideas, concepts,
and information through the selection,
organization, and analysis of relevant content.

58D6F43D19AC40F2AAF7594D07CBB60A.description:
Provide a concluding statement
or section that follows from the argument
presented.

E1238FC086424CB691F40936B4DB4E12.description:
Establish and maintain a formal
style.

1100B5B0107D44E3BC6687041A991B9A.description:
Use words, phrases, and clauses
to clarify the relationships among claim(s)
and reasons.

58E840B5A4994AE3B9DCF78E1C7A4CCE.description:
Support claim(s) with clear
reasons and relevant evidence, using
credible sources and demonstrating an
understanding of the topic or text.

2604585F2BC948FCA6A178A0D011C1F5.description:
Introduce claim(s) and organize
the reasons and evidence clearly.

43770C318FD74931A42AA038603E819D.description:
Write arguments to support claims with
clear reasons and relevant evidence.

D6F0E1CB115E496EB1683603A8EC1DD2.description:
By the end of the year, read and
comprehend literary nonfiction in the grades 6-
8 text complexity band proficiently, with
scaffolding as needed at the high end of the
range.

7CFD6B7729964B7481770B6910ABDB68.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

5C3642E09701496E8B9C7B12B7DCC9CF.description:
Compare and contrast one author's
presentation of events with that of another
(e.g., a memoir written by and a biography on
the same person).

AEE50FF82A054E8DA90A1A392D1BBC5C.description:
Trace and evaluate the argument and
specific claims in a text, distinguishing claims
that are supported by reasons and evidence
from claims that are not.

F339916689CA400A9E69FC2DC96117E7.description:
Integrate information presented in
different media or formats (e.g., visually,
quantitatively) as well as in words to develop a
coherent understanding of a topic or issue.

FFC491764E5E46D49B167936683283AA.description:
Determine an author's point of view or
purpose in a text and explain how it is
conveyed in the text.

E3F87613E2244D3CBB4949C13E6F765B.description:
Analyze how a particular sentence,
paragraph, chapter, or section fits into the
overall structure of a text and contributes to
the development of the ideas.

83571E8555F34598B63776243AC4AC00.description:
Determine the meaning of words and
phrases as they are used in a text, including
figurative, connotative, and technical
meanings.

BDD977EE756249BF8613BA4C40A8E3C3.description:
Analyze in detail how a key individual,
event, or idea is introduced, illustrated, and
elaborated in a text (e.g., through examples or
anecdotes).

22462BA854094FC69A402540FC0C415E.description:
Determine a central idea of a text and
how it is conveyed through particular details;
provide a summary of the text distinct from
personal opinions or judgments.

894FD9385B904792BDB95EFD2E8F3C08.description:
Cite textual evidence to support analysis
of what the text says explicitly as well as
inferences drawn from the text.

D742E24CD21246938B9608E94FA1FA9D.description:
By the end of the year, read and
comprehend literature, including stories,
dramas, and poems, in the grades 6-8 text
complexity band proficiently, with scaffolding
as needed at the high end of the range.

A75488C984B0451DA4174DBF6867D1D9.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

8D4BE7A85ADB492BBC51E7CA4439EB5A.description:
Compare and contrast texts in different
forms or genres (e.g., stories and poems;
historical novels and fantasy stories) in terms
of their approaches to similar themes and
topics.

F5758A05A00D46D09EABCB398AC67042.description:
Compare and contrast the experience
of reading a story, drama, or poem to listening
to or viewing an audio, video, or live version of
the text, including contrasting what they "see"
and "hear" when reading the text to what they
perceive when they listen or watch.

5575B029AA5740B8AFF3E1DD8A5D34E8.description:
Explain how an author develops the
point of view of the narrator or speaker in a
text.

78ACBD857DCB4AB9B00EDAC261DD3A29.description:
Analyze how a particular sentence,
chapter, scene, or stanza fits into the overall
structure of a text and contributes to the
development of the theme, setting, or plot.

DECE85D2D32845718C05EAD7BCEEBFE7.description:
Determine the meaning of words and
phrases as they are used in a text, including
figurative and connotative meanings; analyze
the impact of a specific word choice on
meaning and tone.

C051601B666542C3A9CFAB79690BEEBE.description:
Describe how a particular story's or
drama's plot unfolds in a series of episodes as
well as how the characters respond or change
as the plot moves toward a resolution.

3C44FE642F6B43C089ACFE21EF90B4E2.description:
Determine a theme or central idea of a
text and how it is conveyed through particular
details; provide a summary of the text distinct
from personal opinions or judgments.

5B136C724E9C4AC6BFCA272DF77B051C.description:
Cite textual evidence to support
analysis of what the text says explicitly as well
as inferences drawn from the text.
